intro: Berzelia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa berzelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that can range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. Berzelia squarrosa is generally found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
